description.displayText: Violeta was employed by our family 2015-2017.  During that time she cared for our invalid mother who was wheelchair bound.  Violeta's duties included all mom's physical care, meal preparation, laundry and light house work.  She drove my mother to doctor appointments and on daily errands using our handicapped van.  She was independent and required very little assistance in caring for mom.  Violeta was exceptionally caring, trustworthy, and patient.  She has common sense, is calm under pressure, and is willing to take charge in a crisis.  She is a rare find, and if you have the opportunity to hire her, don't hesitate.  She will quickly win your appreciation.

description.displayText: She is an excellent caregiver. Very caring and trustworthy. During the years while she was taking care of my limited mobility father she provided the best care. Always exceeding our expectations and stepping out of her personal life to put the needs and necessities of my father. She was always helping my sick mother during her difficult times while battling with her health issues. Violeta has become part of our family.

Always exceeding our expectations and stepping out of her personal life to put the needs and necessities of my father. description.displayText: Violeta cared for my mother for three years as a live-in aide and took excellent care of her. We only let her go because my mother deteriorated physically to the point where we needed to move her into a nursing home. During the three years she was with us, she took care of all my mother's personal needs, shopped and cooked nutritious meals, took her to doctor's appointments and did basic housekeeping. But more than that, she got my mother out of the house and doing things like trips to the beach and out for ice cream, taking her to the senior center and etc. She developed a true bond with my mother that made her later years much more enjoyable.
